what: Example 2: command line interface to simulations
title: ERAHUMED Data Analysis and Visualization
text: following example illustrates workflow manually running ERAHUMED simulation chain, extracting outputs various simulation layers. detailed information, see main package vignette. bird’s eye view various simulation pipeline components also available, . pipeline always starts initializing ERAHUMED simulation, via: main abstraction erahumed uses collect various layers involved simulation chain DSS, namely: output shows, layers simulation initialized computed yet. can modify configuration specific layers setup_*() functions, instance: order actually compute layers, use run_simulation(): Simulations composed following layers (dependency order, upstream downstream): INP [setup_inp()]: INPut data. hbl [setup_hbl()]: Hydrological Balance Albufera lake. hbc [setup_hbc()]: Hydrological Balance rice Paddy clusters. CA [setup_ca()]: Chemical Applications. ctc [setup_ctc()]: Chemical Transport. order inspect results given layer, use: information simulation interface, can consult ?erahumed_simulation_interface.
code: library(erahumed) simulation <- erahumed_simulation() simulation #> An ERAHUMED simulation. #> Computed layers: None erahumed_layers() #> [1] "inp" "hbl" "hbp" "hbd" "ca"  "ctc" simulation <- simulation |>   setup_hydrology(ideal_flow_rate_cm = 2.5) |>   setup_exposure(dact_m = 0.2) simulation <- simulation |>   run_simulation(layer = "hbl")  # Run simulation until the hbl layer get_layer(simulation, "hbl") #> A ERAHUMED HBL simulation layer. #>  #> Output columns: level, precipitation_mm, evapotranspiration_mm, date, is_imputed_level, is_imputed_outflow, volume, volume_change, volume_change_petp, outflow_pujol, outflow_perellonet, outflow_perello, outflow_recirculation, outflow_total, inflow_total, residence_time_days get_layer_parameters(simulation, "hbl") Expressed centimeters per day. height_thresh_cm [numeric(1)]  positive number.
